001import java.util.HashMap;
002
003/**
004 * This class is part of the RPandaScape application. 
005 * RPandaScape is a very simple, text based adventure game.
006 * 
007 * It exists 2 list of items in the current game.
008 * One in each room and the other is used as the player inventory.
009 * @see Room
010 * @see Player
011 * 
012 * A list of items have certains methods in order to manage the items better.
013 * @see Item
014 * It is composed of a hashMap with :
015 * Item as key
016 * Integer as value (the number of the item present in the list)
017 *
018 * @author Elie DUBOUX
019 * @version 2021.12.12
020 */
021public class ItemList
022{
023    /**
024     * The list of items.
025     */
026    private HashMap<Item,Integer> aItems;
027    /**
028     * The total price of the items in the list.
029     */
030    private int aWeightTotal;
031    /**
032     * The total price of the items in the list.
033     */
034    private int aPriceTotal;
035    /**
036     * Constructor.
037     */
038    public ItemList()
039    {
040        this.aItems = new HashMap<Item,Integer>();
041        this.aWeightTotal = 0;
042        this.aPriceTotal = 0;
043    }//ItemList()
044    
045    /**
046     * Add an item X times in the list.
047     * @param pItem The item.
048     * @param pItemNb The number of times.
049     */
050    public void addItems(final Item pItem, final int pItemNb)
051    {
052        if (this.containItem(pItem.getName()))
053        {
054            int vNumber = this.aItems.get(pItem);
055            this.aItems.replace(pItem, vNumber, vNumber+pItemNb);
056        }
057        else
058            this.aItems.put(pItem, pItemNb);
059        
060        this.aWeightTotal += pItem.getWeight()*pItemNb;
061        this.aPriceTotal += pItem.getPrice()*pItemNb;
062    }//addItems()
063    
064    /**
065     * Remove an item X times from the list.
066     * @param pItem The item.
067     * @param pItemNb The number of times.
068     */
069    public void removeItems(final Item pItem, final int pItemNb)
070    {     
071        int vNumber = this.aItems.get(pItem);
072        if (vNumber == pItemNb)
073            this.aItems.remove(pItem);
074        else
075            this.aItems.replace(pItem, vNumber, vNumber-pItemNb);
076        
077        this.aWeightTotal -= pItem.getWeight()*pItemNb;
078        this.aPriceTotal -= pItem.getPrice()*pItemNb;
079    }//removeItem()
080    
081    /**
082     * Check if an item is in the list with his name.
083     * @param pItemName The name of the item.
084     * @return True if the list contains the item,
085     * false if not.
086     */
087    public boolean containItem(final String pItemName)
088    {
089        return this.getItem(pItemName) != null;
090    }//containItem()
091    
092    /**
093     * Return the item of the list with the given name, 
094     * is null if it is not in the list.
095     * @param pItemName The name of the item.
096     * @return The item.
097     */
098    public Item getItem(final String pItemName)
099    {
100        for (Item vItem : this.aItems.keySet())
101            if (vItem.getName().equals(pItemName))
102                return vItem;
103        return null;
104    }//getItem()
105    
106    /**
107     * Check the item is present enough times in the list of items.
108     * @param pItem The item.
109     * @param pItemNb The number of the item.
110     * @return true if the list of items has enough time the item,
111     * false if not.
112     */
113    public boolean hasEnough(final Item pItem, final int pItemNb)
114    {
115        return this.aItems.get(pItem) >= pItemNb;
116    }//hasEnough()
117    
118    /**
119     * Return the weight of all the items in the list.
120     * @return The total weight of the list.
121     */
122    public int getWeightTotal()
123    {
124        return this.aWeightTotal;
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Return the price of all the items in the list.
129     * @return The total price of the list.
130     **/
131    public int getPriceTotal()
132    {
133        return this.aPriceTotal;
134    }
135    
136    /**
137     * Override the toString methode in order to get the list of items with their
138     * number in () in a String format.
139     * @return The list of items in a String format.
140     */
141    @Override public String toString()
142    {
143        StringBuilder vItems = new StringBuilder("");
144        
145        if (this.aItems.isEmpty())
146        {
147            vItems.append("No item.\n");
148            return vItems.toString();
149        }
150
151        for (Item vItem : this.aItems.keySet())
152            vItems.append("\t"+ this.aItems.get(vItem) +"  *  " + vItem.toString());
153        return vItems.toString();
154    }//toString()
155}//ItemList
